article.headline: Mississippi 82, Marshall 78
article.story: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla. -- Mississippi's Chris Warren led all scorers with 28 points, including five in the final 43 seconds, to lead the Rebels to an 82-78 victory over Marshall in the Glenn Wilkes Classic on Sunday. Warren, a unanimous selection for the Southeastern Conference all-freshman team last season, made 9 of 17 shots from the floor and converted 8 of 9 free throws. The sophomore guard also had four assists and three steals. David Huertas contributed 21 points for Ole Miss (3-1). Shaquille Johnson scored 15 points to pace Marshall (1-3), which also got 14 points on 7-of-7 shooting by Marcus Goode. Tyler Wilkerson had 12 points and 14 rebounds, and Markel Humphrey added 11 points and nine rebounds for the Thundering Herd. The Rebels broke the final tie, at 72, when Huertas made a 3-pointer with 1:58 to play and never trailed again.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
